text: Health Secretary has announced plans to
significantly increase coronavirus
testing in the UK Matt Hancock who has
just returned from self-isolation after
contracting the virus said he hoped that
100,000 tests could be carried out every
day in England by the end of the month
universities and private firms will be
called in to help after days of intense
criticism he admitted there had been big
challenges with testing from the outset
with delays meaning previous targets had
not been hit today it was announced that
569 more people have died from corona
virus in the past 24 hours bringing the
total number of confirmed reported
deaths in the UK to 2921
here's our political editor Norah
keansburg will there be enough not a

could be the difference in treatment
that is the difference between life and

if the drivers of these cars are

we should be be first so that we can

here's our health editor Hugh pen
the first day of coronavirus testing at
one of Britain's leading science

Institute labs here used for work in

the government called on academic and

that this whole covert 19 has exposed
that the country wasn't as well prepared

research centre they've started serious

what all the public health laboratories
in England were doing in the early
stages of the corona virus outbreak a
priority now for all labs is testing NHS

in Dundee they've already started doing
that these doctors and nurses in full

patients with kovat 19 in a high

comprehensive programme of testing

how does the number of coronavirus

one recorded compared with other
countries Spain
has seen a faster rate of increase South

affected nations so how will the UK get
through it all a question I put to
support us we will get through it and
when we get through it we will have the
potential vaccines will have potential
treatments and we will learn how to
manage it if it doesn't go away in the
future but make no mistake two things it
has damaged us and the second thing is
the only way through this is through
scientists and experts finding their way
through it drive through testing centers
for NHS staff in the London area have
been set up but this one appeared
strangely quiet today even though many

tested a government source said it was a
